page.title: 14 THE BARRACKS,MAIDSTONE
page.content: Sitting to the South of Springfield Mill on the{River Medway}lies the {Barracks,}Maidstone - an old group of buildings laid out in the traditional turn-of-the-century style with barrack blocks surrounding an open square. Originally built to house the{Kent} {County Regiment -The Royal West } {Kents ('The Buffs'),}it now houses 61 Support Squadron Royal Engineers which are part of 36 Engineer Regiment at Invicta Park, Maidstone. Standing as it does near the town centre, a close link has developed with the townspeople of Maidstone. 'The Buffs' have now disbanded, but are remembered with affection and the Town Museum also houses the{Regimental Museum.}The Barracks, a link with the past, may soon go if plans for a new ring road around Maidstone are agreed. by Lynne Doyle
